Posts.Content: Mar 23, 2011 09:20AM BrandyB wrote: You are NOT a baby!!!  That radiologist is a jerk!!! -Just saying...
Posts.Title: OK, need biopsy. Snarky radiologist, too. iammommy janet58

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2011 06:28PM - edited Feb 23, 2011 06:29PM by BrandyB The time FLIES BY. It will be over before you know it. As far as the tape is concerned, I just did my best to keep it on. It's not really a big deal bc they see you EVERYDAY. If the tape begins to peel or the lines fade, they'll touch them up. The tape they use is very soft and flexible so it never bothered me. As far as people seeing the markings... I never gave a care in the world about that! Let them think I had some cool tribal markings or whatever. What did I care? You are in the home stretch now baby!!!! I'm sure you'll meet some amazing people during your radiation treatments (as I did). Do Yoga breathing and guided imagery while the radiation is happening.Lead the radiation straight to those little bastard cancer cells!!!! Let them fry!!!! Send mental energy to your healthy cells to 'hang in there, you can do it. Put up a good fight!' Now that you know how crazy I really am... I hope that helped some :) Brandy
Posts.Title: Starting Rads tomorrow Questions? LovemyLife12 BrandyB

Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2011 07:45AM BrandyB wrote: This is a public service announcement... Bald women have power. During treatment I accomplished all sorts of things merely by showing up bald. NO ONE says no to a bald woman. I was in cahoots with a mother of a leukemia patient and I had his school wrapped around my finger. Nobody says no to a cancer mom speaking on behalf of a cancer kid!!! If you have the energy you can wield you power for good.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2011 07:28PM - edited Aug 31, 2011 07:31PM by BrandyB Oh Marjie, you have one too?!?
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2011 12:14PM - edited Aug 8, 2011 12:15PM by BrandyB Wow ladym, your hair is so straight and sleek and shiney!!! I'm over one year out from chemo and my hair is totally out of control curly. I dye mine brown as well, but I've been doing that for years, but the curls are sooooo tight. I've been wearing a headband and letting it go crazy like an Afro. I always had a secret longing to have an Afro. They seem so cool and easy, but mine is not easy. It's taking all of my efforts not to look like Ronald McDonald! I've been following the hair care instructions in The Curly Girl book by Lorraine Massey. The tips really help, but as my hair gets longer it seems to just get taller!!! I'm trying to embrace my curls and my new look, but sometimes it's sortof hard. I look like my black standard poodle. Talk about people turning into their pets!!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2011 06:26PM - edited Aug 31, 2011 06:27PM by BrandyB The whole time he tells me "You look HOT baby!!" Even when I was fat and bald and sporting one boob and surgical drains!! That was his story and he was sticking to it. I gotta love that man.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2011 06:24PM BrandyB wrote: My husband brags to his friends that I change looks so often that it's like he constantly has a new girlfriend. He says all the girlfriends have looked so different, but funnily enough, they all have the same bitchy personality!!!! LOL!!! He's hysterical!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2011 10:51AM BrandyB wrote: I waited until I couldn't stand the mess anymore then I went "all Britney Spears" and shaved it myself but the clippers ran out of charge before I could finish and I ended up looking like a deranged maniac... During and after my hair fell out my scalp was very sore. I even had little pimple like places. It felt like a bad sunburn. Anyway I can't imagine shaving it with a razor-it was simply too tender. Good luck!! Just try to keep smiling and you'll get thru it :) Brandy
Posts.Title: when losing hair... ninastar Letlet

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2011 02:02PM BrandyB wrote: I was so afraid of what my kids would think of me bald. But as soon as my daughter saw me bald for the first time she screamed. "Charles, John come quick!! Mommy looks like a really cool army dude!!!!". That made me feel so much better. We laughed and cried and it was OK.
Posts.Title: when losing hair... ninastar Letlet

Posts.Content: BrandyB wrote: I've had two headaches this week.  They start out as regular headaches and then I worry and worry about brain mets until I'm a total wreck.  When can I just have a headache without thinking that I'll die from it?  Somedays are scary as hell.  I did have a clear brain mri Thanksgiving of last year (so 4 months ago)  Could it be cancer already growing and causing symtoms in 4 months?  Please tell me no.  Please tell me I'm a crazy hypochondriac...  I go for a followup next week with my onc.  Good times... Good times... Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: When Headache Turns Panic Attack BrandyB vivvygirl

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2011 09:55PM BrandyB wrote: Just wanted to chime in. I've recently traveled to Boston to consult with Dr. Irene Kuter at Mass General and she is completely and absolutely fantastic! I had a scare recently and I went to Dr Kuter for a second opinion and she is top notch. I had to wait like 1.5 hours in the waiting room, but it was so worth it. She stayed and discussed my case from 5:00 to 7:00 pm. She is level headed, experienced, knowledgable, respected in her field, there aren't enough good things that I can say about her. You are in a great place with wonderful doctors and I'm glad you found this website. I respect the women on this board. Hang in there, this is the worst part. Brandy
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed and trying to keep it together Leighsa Joan811

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2011 08:44PM BrandyB wrote: Thanks Viv.  I'll take it one breath at a time until the feeling passes...  Sure is brutal tho.  I have been on a mission to really be kind to myself.  Physically kind and emotionally kind.  It's hard sometimes, but it is making a difference in my life.
Posts.Title: When Headache Turns Panic Attack BrandyB vivvygirl

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2012 08:45AM BrandyB wrote: (((Hugggss))))) My wish is that after your scans, we will never hear from you again because everything will be benign.  Just try to stay in the present and not make up stories about what the future may be.  The terrible things that we imagine when we are worried are just stories that we make up in our minds.  Try to take things one minute at a time.  (I know that is easier said than done)
Posts.Title: Head spinning. Just need to share Amyls barbe1958

Posts.Content: BrandyB wrote: Hi everyone, I had a pretty freaky thing happen this past weekend. I'm about 9 weeks out from a DIEP reconstruction and my abdominal muscles started to seize up, sort of like a cross between a Charlie horse and a labor contraction. The cramps were pretty intense and scary. I called my plastic surgeon who told me that these cramps are not uncommon with the DIEP reconstruction and prescribed a muscle relaxer. The muscle relaxer helped but didnt completely stop the cramps. Before I spoke with the PS, I was pretty freaked out thinking that it was a recurrence. It was imagining a tumor growing in my abdomen. It would go something like this: cramp, anxiety, nausea from the anxiety, then heart palpitations from the anxiety. I just wanted to share this just in case it happens to someone else.
